page.title: 12SHOPPING IN SHROTON
page.content: THERE ARE TWO SHOPS IN SHROTON. WE ASKED THE SHOPKEEPERS IN THE{VILLAGE {STORES}AND{POST OFFICE}AND FOUND OUT THAT BOTH SHOPS HAD BEEN THERE SINCE BRFORE THE WAR. ONE OF THEM WAS A BAKERY 20 YEARS AGO BUT HAS RECENTLY BEEN TURNED INTO A VILLAGE STORE. THE STORE NOW SELLS DRINKS, SPREADS, EGGS, GROCERIES AND PAPERS. THE POST OFFICE GETS ITS GROCERIES FROM THE CASH AND CARRY. THE VILLAGE SHOPS ARE USED BY THE VILLAGERS DURING THE WEEK FOR ODDS AND ENDS OR DAILY SHOPPING. THE POST OFFICE IS USEFUL FOR STAMPS AND ELDERLY PEOPLE DRAWING OUT THEIR OLD AGE PENSIONS. THE MAIN WEEKLY SHOPPING BY THE VILLAGERS IS DONE IN SUPERMARKETS IN BLANDFORD WHICH PROVIDE CHEAPER GROCERIES THAN IN THE VILLAGE. OTHER POPULAR{SHOPPING TOWNS}ARE STURMINSTER NEWTON, SHAFTESBURY AND SALISBURY.
